The data is identified into 3 groups:
1. features - The data that associates to the file X_train.txt/X_test.txt files.
2. activities - The data that associates to the file y_train.txt/y_test.txt file
3. subject - The file that associated to subject_train.txt/subject_test.txt.

There are certain columns that need to be picked from the X_train.txt/X_test.txt file that we are referred from the features.txt file and created a seperate vector called as "extracted.features". 
Similarly another vector "extracted.feature.names" that will help get the corresponding headers is also created.
The activties and activities.names vectors are used to map the activity names into the y_train.txt/y_test.txt file.

The merged data of features, activity and subject is assigned into all.data variable.

all.data will have only the mean and std deviations that are expected.

It will also have the headers in descriptive format.

Using the melt function we set subject, activity as the index and all other columns as values so that they can be averaged out.

"all.data.wide" -> This will be the variable that will have the data frae with mean of all the columns.

This data is then written into another variable called "all.data.clean" which is written into a data table.

The output will look like follows :
